    • Reproducing Spatial Domain Identification of DLPFC with DOST

DOST: Distance-preserving Optimization for Spatial Transcriptomics

Source: R/DOST-package.R
DOST-package.Rd

DOST is a distance-preserving optimization based method that clusters spatial transcriptomics (ST) spots into spatial domains. DOST embeds ST spots into a low-dimensional space using a Sammon mapping inspired loss function that jointly preserves gene expression similarity and spatial smoothness.

See also

Useful links:

  • https://github.com/misratasci/DOST

  • https://misratasci.github.io/DOST/
